customer_addr:
2976 E. State St Suite 120 #211
Eagle, ID 83616

citations.narrative:
Guests are allowed to enter the parakeet atrium to interact with the birds by feeding a pelleted diet from a ladle-like
melamine feeding bowl weighing 174grams (0.4 pounds) when empty. One parakeet died on 2/1/2025 during a guest
feeding encounter when a startled toddler dropped the feeding bowl on top of the bird. Patrons are instructed that young
children/toddlers are not allowed to hold the bowls; however, the attendant did not notice that instructions were not being
followed. The attendant is no longer employed at the facility.
The facility must take measures to ensure safe handling with sufficient distance and/or barriers between the birds and the
general viewing public to assure the health and safety of all animals.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.131(c)(1)  Critical Repeat
   
Handling of animals. 
Guests are allowed to enter the parakeet atrium to interact with the birds by feeding a pelleted diet from a ladle-like 
melamine feeding bowl weighing 174grams (0.4 pounds) when empty. One parakeet died on 2/1/2025 during a guest 
feeding encounter when a startled toddler dropped the feeding bowl on top of the bird. Patrons are instructed that young 
children/toddlers are not allowed to hold the bowls; however, the attendant did not notice that instructions were not being 
followed. The attendant is no longer employed at the facility.  
 
The facility must take measures to ensure safe handling with sufficient distance and/or barriers between the birds and the 
general viewing public to assure the health and safety of all animals. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative. 
 
 n
